name: Banana
description: a long curved fruit which grows in clusters and has soft pulpy flesh and yellow skin when ripe

name: Apple
description: a fruit that is round, usually red or green, and has a firm white flesh and a core in the center

name: Dog
description: a domesticated carnivorous mammal with a shaggy coat, short legs, and a long snout

name: Cat
description: a small carnivorous mammal with soft fur, a short snout, and retractile claws

name: House
description: a building for human habitation, especially one that is lived in by a family or small group of people

name: Tree
description: a woody perennial plant that typically has a single stem or trunk, supporting branches and leaves

name: Car
description: a road vehicle with an engine, four wheels, and seats for a small number of passengers

name: Book
description: a written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side and bound in covers

name: Music
description: vocal or instrumental sounds (or both) combined in such a way as to produce beauty of form, harmony, and expression of emotion

name: Guitar
description: a stringed musical instrument with a fretted fingerboard and typically six strings, played by plucking or strumming

name: Computer
description: an electronic device that can store, retrieve, and process data

name: Phone
description: a device that can be used to make and receive calls and send messages, typically consisting of a screen and buttons or a touchscreen for input

name: Table
description: a piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs, used as a surface for working at, eating from, or on which to place things

name: Chair
description: a separate seat for one person, typically with a back and four legs

name: Watch
description: a small timepiece worn on a person's wrist or carried in a pocket

name: Bag
description: a flexible container with an opening at the top, used for carrying things

name: Shoe
description: a covering for the foot, typically made of leather, with a sturdy sole and not reaching above the ankle

name: Television
description: an electronic device for receiving and displaying moving images and sound

name: Bicycle
description: a vehicle with two wheels that is moved by pedals

name: Coffee
description: a hot drink made from the roasted and ground seeds (coffee beans) of a tropical shrub

name: Pizza
description: a dish of Italian origin, consisting of a flat round base of dough baked with a topping of tomatoes, cheese, and other ingredients

name: Football
description: a game played with a ball by two teams of eleven players, each attempting to score by putting the ball into the other team's goal

name: Garden
description: a piece of ground, often near a house, used for growing flowers, fruit, or vegetables

name: Camera
description: a device for taking photographs or filming, consisting of a lightproof box with a lens at one end and light-sensitive film or an image sensor at the other

name: Sun
description: the star around which the earth orbits and which provides light and heat for the earth

name: Moon
description: the natural satellite of the earth, visible (chiefly at night) by reflected light from the sun

name: Fire
description: the phenomenon of combustion manifested in light, flame, and heat

name: Water
description: a colorless, transparent, odorless liquid that forms the seas, lakes, rivers, and rain and is the basis of the fluids of living organisms

name: Sky
description: the region of the atmosphere and outer space seen from the earth

name: Earth
description: the planet on which we live; the third planet from the sun in the solar system

name: Universe
description: all existing matter and space considered as a whole; the cosmos

name: History
description: the study of past events, particularly in human affairs

name: Science
description: the intellectual and practical activity encompassing the systematic study of the structure and behavior of the physical and natural world through observation and experiment

name: Art
description: the expression or application of human creative skill and imagination, typically in a visual form such as painting or sculpture, producing works to be appreciated primarily for their beauty or emotional power

name: Nature
description: the phenomena of the physical world collectively, including plants, animals, the landscape, and other features and products of the earth

name: Language
description: the method of human communication, either spoken or written, consisting of the use of words in a structured and conventional way
